intro: Dipyrena spartioides, commonly known as the rock dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in dry, sunny environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and bloom in early spring. Dipyrena spartioides is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
